Row.Text: Settling a City assigns it a Nation, granting bonuses, and Units from different Nations receive a Combat bonus when they start Adjacent. Your Forest and Jungle tiles act as Roads, forming [ICON_TRADE] City Connections once possible.
+20% Combat while adjacent to a Unit of a different Nation.
Unique Ranged Swordsman replacement for the Iroquois. Requires no [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron, ignores Zone of Control, and has the Woodsman Promotion.

The Tomahawk Raider is the unique Swordsman replacement for the Iroquois. Unlike the Swordsman it is a powerful Ranged Unit that can shoot a single tile. In addition to this it has movement bonuses in the Woodsman Promotion and by being able to ignore Zone of Control. Finally, the Tomahawk Hunter doesn't cost any [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron to train, making it easier to deploy.

The Tomahawk is an axe-headed tool initially used by the Algonquians, from whom the name is derived. These axes were made of stone - that was, until the Europeans showed up. The introduction of metal working improved the weapons drastically, and also opened up an artisan trade for the tool. It's effectiveness is proven by the fact that it is in use by various modern military units: after all, would you rather a little knife or a throwable axe?
Replaces the Workshop. Provides the Workshop's [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production bonuses in the City, and increases Yields from Forest tiles depending on the City's Nation.

Unique Workshop replacement for the Iroquois. In addition to the Workshop's [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production bonus, as well as the ability to move [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production along Trade Routes from this City, the Longhouse provides additional Yields on Forest tiles depending on the City's Nation.

Replaces the Workshop. Provides the Workshop's [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production bonuses in the City, and increases Yields from Forest tiles depending on the City's Nation. +1 [ICON_JFD_HEALTH] Health from Forests.

Unique Workshop replacement for the Iroquois. In addition to the Workshop's [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production bonus, as well as the ability to move [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production along Trade Routes from this City, the Longhouse provides additional Yields on Forest tiles depending on the City's Nation and +1 [ICON_JFD_HEALTH] Health on each Forest. Does not require any [ICON_JFD_POWER] Power.
Standalone Unit for the Iroquois that may only be trained in Mohawk Cities. Recieves a Combat bonus in Forest and Jungle, and begins with the Woodsman Promotion. Requires no [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron.

The Mohawk Warrior is a standalone Unit for the Iroquois that may only be trained in Cities belonging to the Mohawk Nation. While in Forest and Jungle it recieves Combat and mobility bonuses, and it requires no [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron to train.
+10 XP to Units trained in this City. Allows the training of the Mohawk Warrior upon discovering Iron Working. The Longhouse in this City provides +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production on Forest tiles.
This Unit belongs to the Mohawk Nation.
This City enters We Love The King Day whenever you adopt a Social Policy. The Longhouse in this City provides +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture on Forest tiles.

This City enters [ICON_JFD_WLTKD] We Love The King Day whenever you adopt a Social Policy or adopt a Left or Right [ICON_JFD_REFORM] Reform. The Longhouse in this City provides +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture on Forest tiles.
{1_City} has entered a We Love The King Day!
This Unit belongs to the Onondaga Nation
City [ICON_PEACE] Faith output contributes towards [ICON_STRENGTH] Defence. The Longhouse in this City provides +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith on Forest tiles.
This Unit belongs to the Oneida Nation

Each Camp worked by this City increases [ICON_GOLD] Gold from incoming [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] International Trade Routes by 1, and a source of [ICON_RES_FUR] Furs is spawned near this City. The Longhouse in this City provides +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold on Forest tiles.
This Unit belongs to the Cayuga Nation
Incoming [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] International Trade Routes yield +{1_Gold} [ICON_GOLD] Gold because of Camps worked by this City.

Units receive a 20% Combat bonus near this City, and constructing Defensive Buildings in this City grants [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. The Longhouse in this City provides +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food on Forest tiles.
This Unit belongs to the Seneca Nation
+20% Combat Strength while near a Senecan City.
+{1_Culture} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from constructing a Defensive Building in {2_City}!
Units trained in this City receive additional Flanking bonuses and may retreat from Combat. The Longhouse in this City takes its effect from the nearest Nation.
+50% Flanking Bonuses and may Withdraw from Combat.
Call a Council of the Elder Brothers

The Confederacy is based on consensus, and as such our laws must be agreed upon by our brothers. We shall call a council of the Elder Brothers to debate laws and policies, to ensure our people are happy with them. [NEWLINE]Requirements/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be the Iroquois [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once Per Era [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have a City belonging to one of the Onondaga, Mohawk, or Seneca Nations [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must not have enacted the Call a Council of the Younger Brothers decision this Era [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]2 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Culture} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Each Onondaga, Mohawk, or Seneca City reduces Policy costs by 5% during this Era, to a maximum of 50%.

The Confederacy is based on consensus, and as such our laws must be agreed upon by our brothers. We shall call a council of the Elder Brothers to debate laws and policies, to ensure our people are happy with them. [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Each Onondaga, Mohawk, or Seneca City reduces Policy costs by 5% during this Era, to a maximum of 50%.
Call a Council of the Younger Brothers

The Confederacy is based on consensus, and as such our laws must be agreed upon by our brothers. We shall call a council of the Younger Brothers to debate laws and policies, to ensure our people are happy with them. [NEWLINE]Requirements/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be the Iroquois [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once Per Era [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have a City belonging to one of the Oneida, Cayuga, or Tuscarora Nations [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must not have enacted the Call a Council of the Elder Brothers decision this Era [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]2 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Culture} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Each Oneida, Cayuga, or Tuscarora City reduces Policy costs by 5% during this Era, to a maximum of 50%.

The Confederacy is based on consensus, and as such our laws must be agreed upon by our brothers. We shall call a council of the Younger Brothers to debate laws and policies, to ensure our people are happy with them. [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Each Oneida, Cayuga, or Tuscarora City reduces Policy costs by 5% during this Era, to a maximum of 50%.
Following the conquest of their home, some of our Tuscarora cousins have migrated to this City as refugees and the City now belongs to their Nation!
Following the conquest of their home, some of our Tuscarora cousins have migrated to one of our Cities as refugees, and the City now belongs to their Nation!
We welcome our cousins into their new home!
